author: TNN
description: In response to the Pahalgam tourist massacre, India launched Operation Sindoor, neutralizing approximately 100 terrorists in strikes across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, according to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. At an all-party meeting, Singh assured that India possesses ample ammunition and is prepared to respond firmly to any Pakistani provocation. Political parties united in support of the armed forces, emphasizing national unity against terrorism.
title: 100 hardcore terrorists killed in Indian strikes: Rajnath Singh to parties

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: Pakistani forces initiated heavy mortar fire and shelling, resulting in civilian casualties in Poonch as evacuations were underway. Shelling extended to other border villages in J&K, prompting stepped-up evacuations to community bunkers and safer locations. Indian forces retaliated, and the J&K administration is coordinating evacuation efforts and emergency response for affected residents.
title: 16 killed in Pak shelling, evacuation accelerated in J&K border areas

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Following the closure of 27 airports in north India due to escalating tensions with Pakistan, flights are facing longer routes and potential diversions to more distant airports like Mumbai and Ahmedabad. Airlines are bypassing Pakistani airspace, causing congestion on routes via Mumbai. Indian carriers have relocated aircraft and crew from the affected airports, with IndiGo moving planes from Chandigarh.
title: Airport security at highest level: Pre-boarding checks for flyers

author: VISHWA MOHAN
description: Buoyed by forecasts of a favorable monsoon, the government has set an ambitious foodgrain production target of 354 million tonnes for the 2025-26 crop year. This target, nearly 4% higher than the previous year, aims to capitalize on expected good rainfall. A nationwide awareness campaign will educate farmers on climate-resilient seeds and government programs.
title: Govt sets record foodgrain target of 354 MT on 'good monsoon' forecast

author: TNN
description: Following India's surgical strike on Jaish-e-Muhammed's terror camp, speculation arose about the death of Abdul Rauf Asghar, brother of Jaish chief Masood Azhar. His alleged presence at a funeral, along with senior Pakistan army officers, fueled suspicions. Rauf is considered the mastermind behind several terror attacks, including the IC814 hijack and the Pulwama attack.
title: Plotter of IC814 hijack, Pulwama, Pathankot killed in Bahawalpur?

author: TNN
description: In Meerut, tensions flared as three individuals were arrested for allegedly sharing objectionable pro-Pakistan content on social media platforms. Authorities heightened online surveillance amid ongoing Indo-Pak tensions, leading to arrests based on WhatsApp posts and Instagram remarks. One incident involved an assault on an activist who reported the pro-Pakistan remarks, prompting police to register a case and arrest the accused and a salon owner.
title: Three held in Meerut for 'pro-Pakistan posts'

author: YUDHVIR RANA
description: Daoke, an Amritsar village bordering Pakistan, remains cautiously calm amidst rising tensions. Villagers acknowledge the potential danger of being cut off if the connecting road is targeted, yet express trust in the Indian Army's protection. While some families have taken precautions by sending children to safer areas, daily life continues with a sense of resilience, contrasting with the palpable fear experienced during past conflicts.
title: Village surrounded on 3 sides by Pakistan stays calm amid tensions

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: X (formerly Twitter) has received orders from the Indian government to block over 8,000 accounts, including those of international news organizations and prominent users, citing violations of local laws. X has complied by withholding the accounts in India but disagrees with the government's demands, viewing it as censorship and a violation of free speech.
title: Elon Musk’s X: Indian govt has asked us to block 8,000 accounts, however...

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna has recommended initiating a parliamentary motion to remove Allahabad High Court's Justice Yashwant Varma after a judicial inquiry confirmed a large sum of cash was discovered at his residence. Justice Varma refused to resign, prompting the CJI to inform the President and Prime Minister, setting the stage for a potential impeachment process involving a formal inquiry and parliamentary debate.
title: CJI Sanjiv Khanna urges Centre to initiate steps to oust Justice Varma

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: Following escalating hostilities, India retaliated against Pakistan, targeting air defense systems and other strategic sites after thwarting missile and drone attacks on Indian military bases and civilian areas. Operation Sindoor is underway, with India responding to Pakistan's aggression with targeted strikes and forward deployments. The international community watches as tensions rise between the two nations.
title: India targets Lahore, Pindi, Karachi after foiling multiple Pak attacks

author: VISHWA MOHAN
description: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticized the 1960 Indus Water Treaty as a "historic mistake," asserting the government's commitment to utilizing water allocated to Pakistan for irrigation and hydropower projects. Following a terror attack in J&K, the treaty has been kept in abeyance, potentially benefiting farmers in bordering states with increased water access.
title: Indus Waters Treaty a ‘historic mistake’, says Shivraj Singh Chouhan

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has observed that a long-term live-in relationship between consenting adults implies a voluntary choice, making claims of rape based on a false promise of marriage less credible. The court emphasized the increasing financial independence of women and the prevalence of live-in relationships, urging a less rigid approach in such cases.
title: Live-ins presume consent if sustained over time: Supreme Court

author: RAJESH KUMAR PANDEY
title: Pocso Act not meant to criminalise adolescents' consensual relations: Allahabad HC

author: GAURAV TALWAR
description: A helicopter carrying pilgrims to the Gangotri shrine crashed near Uttarkashi, claiming six lives, including five pilgrims and the pilot. The accident occurred when the chopper veered off course and lost altitude, plunging into a gorge. One passenger survived and is critically injured. Authorities have launched an investigation to determine the cause of the crash, raising concerns about helicopter travel safety in the Himalayas during peak pilgrimage season.
title: Six die as chopper with Char Dham pilgrims crashes near Gangotri

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: US Vice President JD Vance addressed the rising tensions between India and Pakistan, stating that the conflict is "fundamentally none of our business." He acknowledged concerns about nuclear powers in conflict and emphasized the US desire for de-escalation. Vance highlighted India's grievances with Pakistan and affirmed the US will not intervene militarily, focusing instead on encouraging de-escalation.
title: 'That's fundamentally none of our business': JD Vance on India-Pak tensions

author: MAHESH BUDDI
description: In a tragic ambush near the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border, three Greyhounds commandos were killed and another critically injured by Maoist landmine blast. The attack occurred during a counter-insurgency operation in the Wazeedu-Perur forest region, marking the first police casualties in anti-Maoist operations in the state this year. Authorities have launched a manhunt for the Maoist cadres responsible.
title: Three Greyhounds cops killed in Maoist landmine blast

author: FARYAL RUMI
description: Following India's military operation against terror camps in Pakistan, a wave of patriotic fervor has swept across the state, inspiring families to name their newborns 'Sindoor' as a tribute to the nation's resolve. This symbolic gesture reflects the pride and unity felt after 'Operation Sindoor,' launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.
title: Tiny salutes: Newborns named ‘Sindoor’ in show of pride

author: TNN
description: A devastating LPG cylinder explosion in Bikaner's Madan Market commercial complex resulted in nine fatalities, with rescue teams uncovering additional bodies from the collapsed basement floors. The blast, initially mistaken for an airstrike, exposed unauthorized jewellery manufacturing units operating in the basement. Authorities are investigating illegal operations and safety violations, prompting a broader inquiry and sealing of several shops.
title: Toll mounts to 9 in LPG cylinder blast at Bikaner jewellery complex

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has directed the West Bengal government to decide on granting prosecution sanction against co-accused individuals in the cash-for-jobs case involving former minister Partha Chatterjee within two weeks. This order was issued during the hearing of Chatterjee's bail plea, where his lawyer cited the lack of sanction against co-accused as a cause for trial delay.
title: Cash-for-jobs: SC asks WB government to decide on prosecution sanction

author: RAM SUNDARAM
description: A Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) conductor, K Radhakrishnan, faced a false misconduct charge after a passenger mistakenly picked up a soiled ticket. This led to illegal salary recovery and a five-year legal battle. The Madras High Court intervened, ordering MTC to refund the recovered amount of Rs 25,200 with 6% interest and settle all pending retirement dues, highlighting the injustice he suffered.
title: False charge: Chennai bus conductor wins 5-year-long legal battle

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: CJI-designate B R Gavai, poised to become the 52nd CJI, pledged leadership and a long-term vision for the judiciary, echoing former CJI N V Ramana's sentiments. Speaking at the release of Justice Ramana's book, Justice Gavai assured that he would follow Ramana's guidance. Justice Ramana emphasized the moral duty of the CJI and SC judges to support all judges, ensuring they feel secure and protected.
title: If judges not shielded, they may seek political patronage: Ex-CJI

author: TNN
description: West Bengal Governor C V Anand Bose submitted to the Supreme Court the reasons for rejecting the state government's recommendations for vice-chancellors in 17 universities, while approving appointments for 19 others. The court, noting former CJI U U Lalit's involvement in the initial shortlist, has requested him to review the Governor's objections. The matter is adjourned for further hearing.
title: In sealed cover, WB governor lists reasons for not agreeing to 17 VC picks

author: VIBHOR MOHAN AND AJAY SURA
description: Following a High Court order, tensions escalated at the Nangal dam as AAP workers, led by a minister, briefly detained the BBMB chief to prevent water release to Haryana. Punjab's CM accused the chairman of illegally diverting water and stated the diverted water has been restored to Punjab. The High Court has directed the Centre to provide details of the meeting regarding the water release and clarify dispute resolution mechanisms.
title: Led by minister, AAP workers lock up BBMB chairman

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court rebuked BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for his "irresponsible, absurd and scandalous" allegations against the CJI-led bench regarding petitions challenging the Wakf Amendment Act. While the court declined to initiate contempt proceedings, citing its resilience against ludicrous statements, it firmly asserted that any attempt to spread communal hatred or indulge in hate speech must be dealt with an iron hand.
title: SC slams ‘irresponsible’ Dubey, but spares him from contempt

author: KSHITIZ
description: Four Chinese nationals were apprehended by Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) for illegally entering India from Nepal through Raxaul without valid visas. Interrogation revealed they intended to return to Hathaura and Lumbini in Nepal. Investigation agencies, including NIA and IB, are struggling to determine the exact purpose of their visit due to a language barrier, as the individuals primarily respond in Chinese.
title: 4 Chinese held for entering India sans visa through Bihar

author: PRAFULLA MARPAKWAR
description: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), facing criticism for low conviction rates, successfully convicted a retired senior transport official in an 11-year-old bribery case. Rajendra Aknath Nerkar, along with an accomplice, was sentenced for accepting a bribe to return bus documents. This conviction highlights ACB's commitment to prosecuting high-ranking officials despite past challenges with evidence and witness availability.
title: 11 years on, Maharashtra official convicted of taking Rs 1,500 bribe

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Pakistan's continuous shelling across the LoC after India's response to a terrorist attack resulted in more casualties. The death toll has risen to 16 in just over 48 hours. Mortar and heavy artillery fire targeted several sectors, marking the 14th consecutive night of truce violations. Many people were wounded. The Jammu and Kashmir government ordered the closure of educational institutions in five border districts.
title: 14th night of Pakistan truce violation, toll rises to 16

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.
title: 1971 wasn’t half as terrifying for shell-shocked Poonch

author: TNN
description: In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, a massive education fraud has been unearthed, revealing how teachers secured jobs using fake documents. Twin sisters, both named Rashmi, fraudulently worked for 18 years, costing the state over Rs 1.6 crore. Despite a High Court order, 16 teachers with confirmed irregularities remain employed, having collectively drawn nearly Rs 22.9 crore in salaries.
title: After 18 yrs, identical twins who used the same papers to get jobs caught

author: REBECCA SAMERVEL
description: A special CBI court granted bail to gangster Chhota Rajan in a 2009 attempt to murder case, noting that all accused, including Surendrakumar Agrawal, have been on bail since the beginning. Despite the bail in this case, Rajan will remain in jail as he is serving a life sentence for the 2011 murder of journalist J Dey.
title: Chhota Rajan granted bail in 2009 attempt to murder case

author: ANURAG BENDE
description: Sharad Pawar's recent hint about a potential reunion between the two NCP factions has stirred political discussions, suggesting his daughter Supriya Sule may discuss the matter with Ajit Pawar. This development introduces uncertainty for the MVA alliance, as both NCP factions show positive signs towards reconciliation. Simultaneously, speculation arises about a possible reunion between Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS, prompting Congress to reassess its strategy for Maharashtra.
title: Don't be surprised if the two NCP factions unite: Sharad Pawar

author: TNN
description: President Murmu has sanctioned the prosecution of Lalu Prasad in the railways jobs-for-land case, paving the way for a fast-tracked trial. The ED's chargesheets accuse Lalu and associates of accepting land as bribes for railway jobs during his tenure as minister. This sanction allows for daily hearings in a special court, expediting trials in both CBI and ED cases involving alleged corruption and money laundering.
title: Land-for-jobs case: President grants permission to prosecute Lalu

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court declined to halt the deportation of illegal Rohingya Muslim migrants from Delhi, emphasizing that the right to reside in India is exclusive to citizens. The court acknowledged the migrants' right to life but affirmed they would be handled under the Foreigners Act. The Solicitor General assured due process while highlighting national security concerns and India's non-recognition of Rohingya refugees.
title: Right to reside in India only for citizens, Rohingya must go: Supreme Court

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the BCCI is contemplating halting the IPL. The DC vs PBKS match in Dharamsala was disrupted, prompting evacuation plans for players and staff. Overseas players are anxious, awaiting assurances from the BCCI and the government. The IPL Governing Council is meeting to decide the tournament's future, guided by government directives, while teams adjust travel plans.
title: BCCI could opt to halt IPL 2025 keeping the nation's sentiment in mind

author: NASEER GANAI
description: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged PM Modi to prioritize dialogue with Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack, cautioning against military escalation. She highlighted the human cost of conflict, sharing images of children killed in shelling and advocating for peaceful co-existence. PDP legislator Waheed Para echoed this sentiment, emphasizing that J&K bears the brunt of India-Pakistan hostilities and stressing the need for dialogue.
title: Mehbooba asks PM to pick dialogue with Pak over hostilities, cites deaths on either side

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Following the successful air-strikes in Pakistan, Prime Minister Modi directed key secretaries to ensure the readiness and security of essential systems. He emphasized seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity and instructed proactive action on supply chains and infrastructure security. Departments are closely monitoring commodity prices and combating misinformation to maintain stability during potential escalations.
title: PM asks top officers to ensure 'fool-proof' functioning of essential system

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: The Srinagar-Jammu National Highway, a crucial link between Kashmir and the rest of India, was shut down on Thursday due to rain-induced mudslides in Ramban. Hundreds of vehicles were stranded as landslides and shooting stones blocked the road. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for more rain in the region.
title: Rain and landslides shut Jammu-Srinagar highway

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Heavy Pakistani shelling has devastated Nowpora village in Uri, leaving residents like Tahir Talib homeless after his house was destroyed. The intense mortar fire forced families to flee, seeking refuge in Baramulla and Boniyar.  Amidst the ruins and shuttered markets, villagers return briefly to salvage belongings and protect livestock, hoping for an end to the violence that has shattered their lives.
title: Uri’s 72 hours: Tuesday’s peace, Wednesday’s fire, Thursday’s ashes

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: What are kamikaze drones? The ‘suicide drones’ changing modern warfare

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Following cross-border tensions, the BCCI halted the Punjab Kings versus Delhi Capitals match, prioritizing player safety. A special train is being arranged to safely transport players, staff, and the broadcast crew. The BCCI will assess the situation to decide on the tournament's future, with player safety remaining the top priority.
title: BCCI to arrange special train to evacuate players from Dharamsala

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: India shoots down at least 2 Pakistan fighter jets: Report

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Pakistan army using cheap rockets, behaving like Hamas: Defence sources

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Tensions between India and Pakistan led to the abrupt cancellation of the IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala. Players and staff were evacuated as the BCCI scrambled to respond, with Virender Sehwag expressing strong condemnation. The league now faces rescheduling challenges amid heightened security concerns and logistical hurdles.
title: 'Pakistan have escalated the war to save it’s terrorist assets'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Robert Prevost elected first-ever American pope

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio urged India and Pakistan to de-escalate immediately, speaking with S Jaishankar and Shehbaz Sharif. He emphasized US support for direct dialogue and asked Pakistan to end support for terrorist groups, following retaliatory air strikes and India's Operation Sindoor. Blackouts have been enforced in border regions of Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan.
title: US secy speaks to Jaishankar, Pakistan PM, urges 'immediate de-escalation'

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: The match between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) has been called off at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association (HPCA) in Dharamsala.
title: BCCI to arrange special train from Una to evacuate players from Dharamsala

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Following the recent attack in Pahalgam, the Indian government has heightened security measures at all airports and flights nationwide. The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security has mandated secondary ladder point security checks for all passengers and banned visitor entry to terminals.
title: Govt orders 100% pre-boarding checks for all flyers at all airports

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Mother's Day, celebrated on the second Sunday of May, honors mothers and maternal figures for their love and sacrifices. Originating in the early 20th century with Anna Jarvis, it became a national holiday in 1914. The day is marked by gifts, quality time, and expressions of gratitude, with heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to make mothers feel special.
title: Happy Mother's Day: Top 50 wishes, messages, images

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan retaliated against India's Operation Sindoor by targeting Jammu with loitering munitions, mirroring the weapons India used to strike terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK. Indian forces intercepted the incoming missiles and drones, prompting blackouts in Jammu regions and parts of Punjab and Rajasthan.
title: Pakistan targets Jammu with loitering munitions- what are they

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Due to rain at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association (HPCA) in Dharamsala, the match between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) has been called off. Earlier, Shreyas Iyer of Punjab Kings won the toss and chose to bat in the rain-delayed match against Delhi Capitals. DC made one change, replacing Vipraj Nigam with Madhav Tiwari, while PBKS remained unchanged.
title: Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals match called off in Dharamsala

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
title: Trump, Starmer announce 'breakthrough' US-UK trade deal

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Vatican City is abuzz as white smoke billows from the Sistine Chapel, signaling the election of a new Pope after two unsuccessful ballots. A cardinal will soon announce 'Habemus Papam!' from St. Peter’s Basilica, revealing the chosen cardinal's birth name and his selected papal name.
title: White smoke! Papal conclave elects new pope

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: India foils Pakistan's attack on Jammu airport: What we know so far

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla confirmed that Rohit Sharma's Test retirement was his personal decision, with no pressure from the board or selection committee. While an undisputed white-ball icon, Sharma's Test performance varied, excelling at home but facing challenges overseas. Despite his Test retirement, Sharma will continue playing ODIs, allowing India to leverage his experience and talent in the format.
title: No BCCI pressure behind Rohit Sharma’s Test retirement: Rajeev Shukla

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: This digital blackout was the subject of discussion on CBS Mornings, with veteran Vatican correspondent John Allen explaining that the cardinals were entirely cut off from the outside world. Dokoupil chimed in, saying, “They’re raw-dogging the conclave—no phone, no text, no nothing.” Co-hosts Gayle King and Nate Burleson appeared momentarily stunned before continuing the segment with nervous laughter.
title: 'Cardinals are rawdoggign it': CBS anchor faces Catholic fury

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has recommended the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma following a Supreme Court panel's indictment in a cash recovery controversy. The CJI submitted the inquiry report and Justice Varma's response to the President and Prime Minister. Justice Varma has denied the allegations in his responses to both the Delhi high court Chief Justice and the Supreme Court-appointed committee.
title: Cash-at-home row: 'CJI recommends impeachment of Justice Varma'

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Amid rising tensions with Pakistan, Gurdaspur in Punjab declared a complete blackout. This decision follows India's response to Pakistan's actions, including reported damage to Pakistani air defense units. Operation Sindoor, which targeted terror sites inside Pakistan, has further escalated the situation, leading to high alert status in Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat with increased security measures.
title: Complete blackout in Gurdaspur from 9pm - 5am

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court reprimanded BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for his "highly irresponsible" remarks against the court's handling of the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Dubey's comments, including criticism of CJI DY Chandrachud and the court's rulings, were deemed as casting aspersions and reflecting ignorance. The BJP distanced itself from Dubey's statements, emphasizing respect for the judiciary.
title: 'Courts are not as fragile ... ': SC says Nishikant Dubey's remarks on judiciary

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh are keeping their daughter away from the paparazzi to protect her privacy. Sameera Reddy shared her weight loss journey focusing on balanced nutrition and exercise. Mandana Karimi faced backlash for her 'Operation Sindoor' post. Prateik Smita Patil recalled his intense first kiss with wife Priya Banerjee.
title: Deepika Padukone on keeping Dua away from paparazzi: Top 5 news

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri has firmly refuted Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets amidst heightened tensions following India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Misri highlighted Pakistan's history of falsehoods, citing instances dating back to 1947 and its alleged targeting of the Neelum-Jhelum dam.
title: Did Pak shoot down Indian jets? What MEA said

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Beijing responded to Pakistan's claim about using Chinese jets against India. China urged India and Pakistan to show restraint. They condemned terrorism. India rejected Pakistan's claim of shooting down Rafael jets. China supports Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack. Chinese officials met with Pakistani leaders amid rising tensions. Operation Sindoor retaliated against the Pahalgam attack.
title: Did Pakistan use Chinese jets against India? What Beijing said

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian government's Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked several Pakistani news reports regarding Operation Sindoor, launched by the Indian Armed Forces post the Pahalgam attack. PIB has flagged these reports as "Pakistan sponsored propaganda", including false claims of shooting down Indian Rafale jets and targeting the Srinagar airbase.
title: Fake news alert: Government fact checks 'Pak propaganda' on Operation Sindoor

author: Deutsche Welle
description: Germany's domestic intelligence agency has classified the Alternative for Germany (AfD) as a "confirmed right-wing extremist" movement, leading to immediate repercussions. Several federal states are now evaluating the compatibility of AfD membership with civil service roles. The AfD, which became the second-strongest political force in Germany in 2025, faces setbacks in its efforts to gain mainstream acceptance.
title: Germany sees new debate over possible ban of the AfD

author: PRANAV SHUKLA
description: Chennai Super Kings, a dominant force in IPL history, are facing an unusual setback this season, languishing at the bottom. Their reliance on seasoned players like Rahul Tripathi and Ravichandran Ashwin hasn't paid off. However, youngsters Ayush Mhatre, Dewald Brevis, and Urvil Patel have shown promise, with Mhatre's impressive batting and Brevis's explosive half-century offering a glimpse of hope.
title: Glimpse into the future? Ayush Mhatre, Dewald Brevis and Urvil Patel offer potential look at CSK in IPL 2026

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India successfully thwarted Pakistan's drone and missile attacks targeting 15 cities, including Srinagar and Pathankot, on May 7-8. Indian air defense systems neutralized the threats, with debris recovered as evidence. Following this, India responded by striking Pakistani air defense systems, including one in Lahore. Ceasefire violations by Pakistan along the LoC resulted in 16 civilian deaths.
title: How India foiled Pakistan’s plan to target 15 cities

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a swift response to Pakistan's aggression, India deployed its S-400 Sudarshan Chakra air defence system on May 7-8, successfully intercepting drones and missiles aimed at 15 Indian cities. The operation thwarted attempts to damage military installations, with debris recovered as evidence. India retaliated by neutralizing Pakistani air defence systems, including one in Lahore, after the attempted escalation.
title: How India used 'Sudarshan Chakra' to take down Pak drones, missiles

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma has retired from Test cricket. He made the announcement before India's tour of England. Sachin Tendulkar shared an emotional message. Tendulkar gave Rohit his Test cap in 2013. Rohit played 67 Tests and scored 4,301 runs. He captained India in 24 Tests. His last Test was in Melbourne against Australia. He will continue to play ODI cricket.
title: 'I remember ... ': Tendulkar's touching message for Rohit

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
title: IC-814 hijacking mastermind Abdul Rauf Azhar, other top JeM leaders killed in Op Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amidst rising tensions with Pakistan and the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, India has opened two gates of the Baglihar Dam on the Chenab River. This action, following a prior restriction of the river's flow, aims to manage rising water levels due to heavy rainfall and maintain dam pressure in the region.
title: IWT: India opens gates of Baglihar, Salam Dams days after regulating Chenab flow

author: Deutsche Welle
description: During a public rally in Kenya, President William Ruto had a shoe thrown at him, highlighting growing discontent over the rising cost of living. The incident, which led to arrests, reflects public frustration with economic challenges and recent tax hikes. Citizens are urging the government to address their grievances and provide real solutions to ease the financial burden.
title: Kenya: Thrown shoe a 'wake-up call' for President Ruto

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar asserted India's firm stance against any Pakistani retaliation following "Operation Sindoor," a targeted response to a barbaric attack in Jammu & Kashmir. During meetings with Iranian and Saudi counterparts, Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to countering terrorism.
title: Military attack by Pakistan will be met with 'very firm response': S Jaishankar

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India refuted Pakistan's allegations regarding civilian casualties in 'Operation Sindoor'. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri stated those eliminated were terrorists. He questioned Pakistan's state funerals for alleged civilians. Misri highlighted Pakistan's support for terrorism. He recalled Osama Bin Laden's presence in Pakistan. He mentioned the presence of UN-proscribed terrorists in Pakistan. The government previously described Operation Sindoor as focused and non-escalatory.
title: On Pak's civilian killed claim, MEA replies with terrorist's funeral pic

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: India's 'Operation Sindoor,' launched after the Pahalgam attack, has struck a JeM facility in Bahawalpur, potentially delivering justice in the 2002 Daniel Pearl murder case. The targeted facility was a known stronghold of Jaish-e-Mohammed, the terror group linked to Pearl's abduction and killing. This action brings a sense of closure to a long-standing tragedy.
title: Op Sindoor: How India avenged beheaded US journalist Daniel Pearl

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India retaliated against Pakistan's military and drone attacks by neutralizing their air defense system in Lahore. The response involved the Integrated Counter UAS Grid, Israeli Harpy drones, and reportedly, the S-400 Sudarshan Chakra. This action followed Pakistani attacks on multiple Indian locations and escalating border tensions, including civilian casualties.
title: Operation Sindoor Day 2: How India is taking out Pak air defence systems

author: PRATYUSH RAJ
description: Amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the Pakistan Super League (PSL) faces uncertainty. A drone strike near the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium led to the cancellation of two matches, prompting discussions about relocating remaining fixtures to Karachi. Concerns among England cricketers and coaches have also risen following recent military actions, potentially leading to their early departure from the tournament.
title: Operation Sindoor impacts PSL 2025: 2 matches cancelled, tournament in limbo

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan initiated coordinated attacks on military targets in Northern and Western India. India's air defence systems successfully intercepted and neutralised all threats. India responded with targeted strikes on Pakistani air defence systems. This retaliation followed cross-border shelling by Pakistan in Jammu and Kashmir. Sixteen civilians were killed in the unprovoked shelling.
title: Operation Sindoor: India repels drone, missile attack across LoC

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following 'Operation Sindoor,' Prime Minister Modi convened a high-level meeting to bolster national security. The operation was a response to the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Modi emphasised seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity. He directed secretaries to review emergency response and communication protocols. Ministries are enhancing internal processes to address evolving threats and ensure readiness for any contingency.
title: 'Operation Sindoor': PM Modi chairs high-level review meet on national security

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a recent all-party meeting, the government disclosed that 'Operation Sindoor' resulted in the elimination of over 100 terrorists across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, who chaired the meeting, emphasized the ongoing nature of the operation and India's readiness to retaliate against any Pakistani aggression.
title: 'Operation Sindoor still ongoing': Rajnath Singh at all-party meet

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Pahalgam attack: India flays Pak for opposing TRF mention in UN statement

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Pahalgam attack was original escalation: MEA on Op Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced that Operation Sindoor is ongoing, vowing retaliation for any Pakistani aggression following India's strike on terror bases across the border. India continued Operation Sindoor, responding to Pakistan's ceasefire violations with proportionate force. India armed forces destroyed nine terror bases across Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK) a day earlier in which "at least 100 terrorists were killed".
title: Pahalgam payback: Day 2 of Op Sindoor keeps Pakistan on edge

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: Pakistan's shifting narrative on Sajid Mir, a key 26/11 plotter, has exposed its deception in combating terrorism, according to Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. Initially declared a non-entity and then presumed dead, Mir's existence was later acknowledged amid pressure from the FATF.
title: Pak exposed over Sajid Mir terror links, FATF grey list deception

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded the armed forces for 'Operation Sindoor,' which neutralized nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK with remarkable precision, eliminating numerous terrorists in response to the Pahalgam attack. Singh emphasized the operation's accuracy and restraint in avoiding civilian casualties. He warned adversaries against exploiting India's patience, promising a strong response to provocations.
title: 'Precision with which Op Sindoor was executed is unimaginable': Rajnath Singh

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: ‘They want to murder in name of jihad’: Owaisi urges global crackdown on TRF

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Why China didn't take 'much of pro-Pakistan stand' this time? Tharoor explains

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK, drawing strong international support. Western allies like the UK, France, and the US, along with Israel and Panama, backed India's right to self-defense against terrorism. Global leaders condemned the Pahalgam attack and urged Pakistan to address the terror threat within its borders.
title: From US to UK: How world leaders backed India's 'Operation Sindoor'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets, effectively ending the defending champions' playoff hopes. Dewald Brevis's explosive 52 and crucial contributions from Shivam Dube and MS Dhoni secured the victory. In a heartwarming moment, Dhoni's sportsmanship shone as he ensured KKR pacer Chetan Sakariya wasn't missed during the post-match handshakes.
title: 'Wait! one player left': MS Dhoni's viral gesture melts the internet

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: The IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians has been relocated from Dharamsala to Ahmedabad due to the closure of Dharamsala's airport, confirmed by GCA secretary Anil Patel. This change has created logistical challenges for Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings, who face a difficult journey from Dharamsala after their game.
title: Op Sindoor Impact: IPL match to be shifted from Dharamsala

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following India's missile strikes on terrorist facilities, the Pakistan stock market, KSE 100, plummeted over 6%, halting trading. This crash, exacerbated by Operation Sindoor and previous economic measures by India, highlights Pakistan's economic fragility.
title: Operation Sindoor spooks Pak stock market! Trading halted with 6% crash

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan due to Operation Sindoor, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav has offered his services to the nation, highlighting his pilot training. Yadav expressed his willingness to sacrifice his life for the country, stating that he would consider it an honor to serve, as conveyed in his post on X.
title: 'Maine bhi pilot ki training le rakhi hai': Tej Pratap Yadav offers to serve nation

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions escalate along the India-Pakistan border following "Operation Sindoor," a retaliatory strike against terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Indian armed forces targeted LeT and JeM bases with precision weaponry after the Pahagalam attack. In response, the government convened an all-party meeting, led by key ministers, to brief the opposition on the situation and diplomatic efforts.
title: 16 killed in Pak shelling; Rajasthan, Punjab on high alert: Key points

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Following India's 'Operation Sindoor,' which targeted terrorist bases in Pakistan and PoK, Pakistani celebrities like Mahira Khan and Fawad Khan faced backlash for criticizing India's actions. AICWA responded by banning Pakistani artists from working in India and condemning Indian companies collaborating with them. Several Bollywood stars, including Kangana Ranaut, supported the Indian Armed Forces, praising their operation.
title: AICWA strongly reaffirms ban on Mahira Khan and Fawad Khan for ‘anti-India’ statements

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Researchers discovered Eos, a molecular cloud, using ultraviolet light. It is near Earth and lacks carbon monoxide. This cloud lies on the Local Bubble's edge. Eos's discovery helps understand star birth conditions. Scientists propose a NASA mission named Eos. This mission will chart ultraviolet radiation across the Milky Way. It aims to find more hidden molecular clouds.
title: Astronomers discover giant star-forming cloud, 5,000 times larger than the Sun

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Yuzvendra Chahal, the Punjab Kings' spinner, is in the news following his IPL hat-trick against Chennai Super Kings. His Instagram message congratulating RJ Mahvash on her show has reignited dating rumors. This follows Mahvash's praise of Chahal's performance, fueling fan speculation. Chahal's match-winning spell, including dismissing MS Dhoni, further intensified interest in his personal life alongside his on-field achievements.
title: Chahal's latest post for RJ Mahvash goes viral amid dating rumours

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold rate today: Despite rising global prices fueled by Federal Reserve inflation concerns, gold prices in India declined on Thursday due to upcoming U.S.-China trade discussions.
title: Gold rate today: Gold prices slip in India to Rs 96,980 per 10 grams

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Laura Loomer, a far-right activist, wished India good luck. This followed reports about India's Operation Sindoor. Loomer's tweet gained significant traction online. She is known for her controversial views and support for Donald Trump. Loomer has a history of making extreme statements. She has also unsuccessfully run for Congress. She remains a vocal figure in MAGA circles.
title: Operation Sindoor: 'India is going to ...', says Donald Trump's close ally Laura Loomer in viral post on Twitter

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Reliance Jio lauded India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a military action targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh affirmed India's 'Right to Respond' following attacks on its soil, emphasizing the operation's precision and focus on terrorist training camps. In related news, Reliance Jio reported adding over 21 lakh subscribers in the month of March 2025.
title: Operation Sindoor: Reliance Jio shares a 'Pride message'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Air travel faces disruption as several Indian airports halt commercial flights due to Operation Sindoor. The closure affects 27 airports across northern, western, and central India until May 10. Airlines like IndiGo and Air India cancel and reschedule hundreds of flights. Passengers are advised to check flight status. Affected airlines offer refunds and rescheduling options. Delhi airport also reports cancellations.
title: Operation Sindoor: Several airports in India closed - check full list

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit ends his red-ball career as one of India’s most dependable batters in the latter part of his journey. He scored 4,301 runs in 67 Tests, including 12 centuries and 18 half-centuries, at an average of 40.57. Having already bid farewell to T20 Internationals after last year’s World Cup win, the 38-year-old will now be seen leading India only in the ODI format.
title: Rohit Sharma drops bombshell on his future

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following India's launch of Operation Sindoor targeting terror sites, the U.S. issued a security alert advising citizens against travel to Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes, confirmed by the Indian Ministry of Defense on May 7, 2025, retaliated for a deadly attack in Pahalgam. Pakistan responded with artillery shelling along the LoC, leading to casualties and heightened tensions.
title: US issues travel warning for Jammu and Kashmir after Operation Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's defence minister, Khwaja Asif, faced scrutiny on CNN after claiming Pakistan shot down five Indian jets during Operation Sindoor. He cited social media as his source, drawing a sharp response from the anchor. This followed India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, responding to the Phalgam attack that killed 26 people.
title: 'All over social media': Pak minister's bizarre proof of downing Indian jet

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Indian airstrikes on terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, a loud explosion was reported in Lahore, leading to temporary flight suspensions in Karachi, Lahore, and Sialkot. 'Operation Sindoor,' a tri-service mission, targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen infrastructure in response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, asserting India's right to act against cross-border terrorism.
title: Blast heard in Lahore; flight ops at Karachi, Sialkot airports temporarily suspended

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following India's strikes on terror launchpads in Pakistan and PoK after the Pahalgam attack, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are on high alert. Public events are cancelled, schools are shut, and security is tightened. Airports face closures and flight disruptions, while railway stations increase surveillance. The nation prepares for potential retaliation, prioritizing civilian safety and readiness in border states.
title: Borders sealed: Rajasthan, Punjab, Gujarat on high alert after Op Sindoor

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Apple's lucrative $20 billion search deal with Google is in jeopardy as Safari searches decline for the first time in 22 years. Eddy Cue, Apple's SVP, attributes this shift to the rise of AI search tools like ChatGPT. Apple is exploring integrating AI into Safari, but Google remains the default for now due to favorable financial terms.
title: Google deal that Apple SVP Eddy Cue says he has "lost sleep over"

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked Pakistan's false claims of striking an Indian military base in Amritsar, exposing the circulated video as wildfire footage from Chile in February 2024. PIB also refuted claims of shooting down an Indian Rafale jet, clarifying the image was old and unrelated to 'Operation Sindoor.
title: Govt debunks Pakistan's false 'strike at Amritsar military base' claim

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma retired from Test cricket. He criticized the current state of Indian cricket commentary. Sharma pointed out the focus has shifted from the game to views. He contrasted Indian commentary with that of Australia. Sharma highlighted the negativity aimed at players. He played 67 Test matches and captained India in 24 Tests.
title: 'It is very disappointing': Rohit Sharma on Indian commentary

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Single digit outings in Adelaide and early departure in his only innings of the Brisbane Test meant Rohit was done with the middle-order gig. He made up his mind, had that tough talk with Shubman Gill, who had to miss out on a Playing XI spot due to the shuffle, and was back as an opener in front of a capacity crowd at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. India's XI changed, batting order changed but Rohit's returns remained the same. Two more single digits, India lost the Test and pressure on the Indian captain peaked.
title: Rohit Sharma retires: Why writing was on the wall since Boxing Day Test

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Eden Gardens witnessed a powerful display of patriotism during the KKR-CSK IPL clash, with a moving rendition of "Maa Tujhe Salaam" honoring India's defence forces after "Operation Sindoor". However, KKR's batting faltered after a strong start, as CSK's Noor Ahmad's 4/31 restricted them to 179/6, overshadowing the pre-match patriotic fervor despite Russell's effort.
title: Watch: After 'Operation Sindoor', Eden echoes with patriotic fervour

author: MAHESH BUDDI
description: In a tragic incident, three junior commandos from the Telangana's Greyhounds anti-Naxal force were killed in a Maoist-triggered landmine blast along the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border. The explosion occurred during a routine area domination exercise in the Mulugu district. This marks the first fatalities for Telangana Police in anti-Maoist operations this year.
title: 3 Greyhounds commandos killed in landmine blast triggered by Maoists in Telangana

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Following the retaliatory Operation Sindoor, launched after the tragic Pahalgam attack, Alia Bhatt voiced her support for the Indian Armed Forces. The operation targeted terror infrastructure across Pakistan and PoK, responding to the April 22 attack that killed 26 civilians. Bhatt's upcoming projects include 'Alpha' and 'Love and War'.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma has announced his retirement from Test cricket, ending speculation about his future in the format. The 38-year-old will continue to lead India in ODIs, having already retired from T20Is. Sharma scored 4,301 runs in 67 Tests, with 12 centuries. In a recent interview with journalist Vimal Kumar, Rohit opened up about his journey and the doubts he once had about leading India.
title: 'Sabko young captain chahiye ... ': Rohit Sharma opens up

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Tired of restrictive diets? The 80/20 rule offers a balanced approach to eating, allowing you to enjoy your favorite foods without guilt. By focusing on wholesome foods 80% of the time and indulging the other 20%, you can avoid cravings and maintain healthy habits. Celebrities like Drew Barrymore swear by it. However, moderation and mindful choices are key to success.
title: The 80/20 rule for weight loss: How people are shedding pounds without dieting

author: TNN
description: Vadodara celebrated Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a third-generation Army officer, for her address on Operation Sindoor. She served as a military observer in Congo, contributing to peacekeeping efforts and earning commendations. Colonel Qureshi led an Indian Army contingent at Force 18 and motivated thousands of students, receiving numerous awards and recognition for her service and dedication.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: US President Donald Trump is set to unveil a significant trade agreement today with a nation speculated to be Britain. This move occurs amidst global economic concerns, as the Bank of England anticipates cutting interest rates. Britain, actively pursuing new partnerships post-Brexit, recently secured a trade deal with India.
title: US trade deal: Is UK going to be the first on Trump’s list?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Eden Gardens witnessed a powerful display of patriotism during the KKR-CSK IPL clash, with a moving rendition of "Maa Tujhe Salaam" honoring India's defence forces after "Operation Sindoor". However, KKR's batting faltered after a strong start, as CSK's Noor Ahmad's 4/31 restricted them to 179/6, overshadowing the pre-match patriotic fervor despite Russell's effort.
title: Watch: After 'Operation Sindoor', Eden echoes with patriotic fervour

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following India's strikes on terror launchpads, Sonar Fort in Jaisalmer went dark during a security drill, and Rajasthan's border districts were placed on high alert. Schools were indefinitely closed, and civilian flight operations were suspended at several airports, including Jodhpur and Jaisalmer. Air defence systems were activated, and residents reported increased military activity, reflecting heightened tensions.

description: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold exhibits a strong bullish trend, poised to retest its all-time high near ₹99,700, supported by global uncertainties and central bank demand. MCX Silver demonstrates resilience, bouncing from a key Fibonacci retracement level, and is likely to surpass its previous swing high of 98,800, potentially reaching 1,00,000.
title: What's the gold rate outlook for May 8 - should you buy or sell?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: A bomb threat disrupted the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) IPL match at Eden Gardens, prompting a police investigation and heightened security. The threat arrived via email amidst national security concerns following the Pahalgam attack, coinciding with India's 'Operation Sindoor' against terror targets. Chennai Super Kings edged out KKR by two wickets in a nail-biting finish, virtually knocking the defending champions out of IPL playoff contention.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sourav Ganguly lauded Rohit Sharma, following Sharma's Test retirement announcement on Wednesday. Ganguly highlighted Sharma's significant contributions to India's trophy wins and leadership. Sharma, aged 38, played 67 Tests, amassing 4,301 runs with 12 centuries. Despite home dominance, he faced overseas challenges, though he shone in the 2021-22 Pataudi Trophy in England, marking a high point in his Test career.

title: Helicopter with 7 onboard crashes in Uttarkashi, casualties feared

description: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Thursday a day after Operation Sindoor. While Nifty50 was above 24,400, BSE Sensex crossed 80,800.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up over 100 points

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Nana Patekar, the acclaimed Bollywood actor and three-time national award winner, served in the Indian Army during the 1999 Kargil War. Despite initial resistance, he secured permission to join the forces after contacting the Defence Minister, George Fernandes. Patekar spent over two weeks assisting soldiers near the LoC and volunteering at a base hospital, experiencing a profound sense of fulfillment.
title: This Bollywood actor wore the army uniform for real and fought the Kargil War

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following Rohit Sharma's Test retirement, Madan Lal has proposed Jasprit Bumrah for India's Test captaincy, citing his consistent performance and permanent team status. Bumrah's previous captaincy stint includes a win against Australia and a loss against England. Rohit Sharma's retirement marks the end of a career that included 67 Tests, 4,301 runs, and 12 centuries.
title: Who will replace Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the deadly Phalgam terror attack, the Indian Army launched 'Operation Sindoor,' conducting precision strikes on nine terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Satellite images reveal substantial damage to key locations, including the Jamia Mosque in Bahawalpur and a LeT training center in Muridke. The operation targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen bases, carefully avoiding Pakistani military installations.
title: Before & after: Satellite images show damage to terror camps in Pak after Op Sindoor

author: TRISHA TEWARI
description: The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board has announced the GSEB Class 10 Result 2025 on May 8. Students can access their scores on the official website, gseb.org, or via WhatsApp by sending their seat number to 6357300971. Further details on mark verification, supplementary exams, and document submission will be released online soon.
title: Check direct link to download Gujarat Board SSC scorecards here

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets in a thrilling IPL match, keeping their playoff hopes alive while eliminating the defending champions. CSK successfully chased down a target of 180, led by Dewald Brevis's explosive 52 and Shivam Dube's crucial 45. MS Dhoni's unbeaten 17 sealed the victory.
title: MS Dhoni’s CSK end 6-year wait to break unwanted record

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Dr. Mark Hyman highlighted a study indicating that consuming 40 grams of casein protein 30 minutes before bed enhances muscle repair and growth during sleep. Casein, a slow-digesting protein found in dairy, provides a sustained release of amino acids, crucial for overnight muscle recovery. Incorporating casein through shakes or natural sources like cottage cheese can optimize muscle protein synthesis.
title: This one drink before 11pm could boost muscle growth while you sleep

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A nationwide civil defence drill, ordered by the Ministry of Home Affairs, included a blackout in Amritsar to assess emergency preparedness. The exercise, part of Operation Sindoor following a terrorist attack, involved switching off lights at key locations, including the Golden Temple, between 10:30 pm and 11 pm. Similar blackouts were observed in other states and cities across India.
title: Watch: Blackout at Amritsar's Golden Temple as lights switched off for mock drill

author: AP
description: In Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial, a federal judge cautioned his lawyer, Mark Geragos, about public comments, deeming his description of prosecutors as a "six-pack of white women" outrageous. Jury selection is ongoing, with opening statements set for Monday. Combs, who has pleaded not guilty to racketeering and sex trafficking charges, remains jailed.
title: Diddy trial: Judge scolds lawyer for calling prosecutors 'pack of white women'

author: SHANKAR RAGHURAMAN
description: With 13 matches remaining, CSK, RR, and SRH are out of playoff contention. GT, RCB, and PBKS are almost certain to qualify, while MI and DC have a decent chance. LSG and KKR face slim odds, but with 8,192 possible outcomes, nothing is guaranteed. GT has a 99.3% chance of finishing in the top four and a 74.
title: IPL playoff scenarios: Odds explained for each team

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a surprising move, the NFL announced that Washington, D.C. will host the 2027 NFL Draft, with former President Donald Trump delivering the news from the Oval Office. Commissioner Goodell thanked Trump for his support. Trump praised Commanders owner Josh Harris and Mayor Muriel Bowser, even commenting on the team's quarterback.
title: NFL sparks political firestorm by having Trump announce 2027 draft from White House

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: HSBC downgraded Avenue Supermarts citing margin pressures, while Macquarie maintained an outperform rating on HPCL after strong quarterly earnings. Morgan Stanley remains overweight on KEI Industries, highlighting robust cable and wire revenue growth. Jefferies reiterated a buy rating for Polycab, noting market share gains and strong sales.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump is set to unveil a major trade deal tomorrow, amid ongoing trade tensions, particularly with China, and the start of US-China talks in Switzerland. The announcement follows recent US tariff impositions on Chinese imports, which Trump defends as necessary to correct trade imbalances. The market has reacted cautiously, and the Federal Reserve warns of potential economic reshaping.
title: Trump to announce 'major trade deal' with a ‘big and highly respected’ nation

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: Home Minister Amit Shah has directed states and Union Territories bordering Pakistan and Nepal to heighten security measures at vulnerable points, including vital installations, to counter potential threats. This directive follows a security assessment indicating possible retaliation from Pakistan, focusing on critical infrastructure.
title: Be on alert, secure vulnerable points: Amit Shah to border states

author: TNN
description: Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite communications venture, has received a Letter of Intent from the Indian Department of Telecom for a satcom license. This development coincides with ongoing trade negotiations between India and the US. The approval is expected to foster competition in the telecom sector and benefit Indian internet users, paving the way for new investments and advancements in the telecom ecosystem.
title: Elon Musk's Starlink gets LOI for satcom licence

author: CHETHAN KUMAR
description: Following India's Op Sindoor, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has heightened its alert status, mandating overtime for staff to ensure the readiness of IAF's fighter planes. Engineers and technicians are prepared for immediate deployment for repair work, with additional shifts implemented and a willingness to operate around the clock. HAL, the fourth line of service, is crucial for maintaining fighter planes during emergencies.
title: HAL on high alert for IAF fighter fleet care

author: TNN
description: Families of victims killed in a recent terrorist attack express solace and gratitude following India's retaliatory airstrikes, dubbed 'Operation Sindoor.' They believe justice has been served and that the action brings peace to the souls of their loved ones. Many implore the government to continue its offensive against terrorists to ensure the safety and security of the nation and prevent future tragedies.
title: Husbands killed by terrorists, justice delivered by Operation Sindoor

author: TNN
description: Key INDIA bloc leaders have voiced their strong support for the Indian armed forces' precision strikes against terror infrastructure in Pakistan and POK, following the Pahalgam attack. Leaders like M.K. Stalin, Mamata Banerjee, Sharad Pawar, and Akhilesh Yadav emphasized national unity and the necessity of a firm response to terrorism, setting aside political differences to back the government's actions.
title: INDIA bloc leaders back operation, laud valour of defence forces

author: TNN
description: Prominent Muslim figures across India have voiced their strong support for the nation's military action against terror camps inside Pakistan, following the Pahalgam massacre. Clerics and political leaders alike emphasized the need for national unity and communal harmony in the fight against terrorism. They hailed the operation as a necessary step to protect citizens and send a strong message globally.
title: Muslim clerics, netas back operation against Pakistan terror infra

author: TNN
description: India's response to the Pahalgam killings was multifaceted, employing both military action and symbolic messaging. Operation Sindoor, named after the Hindu symbol of marriage, avenged the loss of Hindu women targeted by terrorists. The briefing was led by Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a Muslim, and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, a Hindu, showcasing India's unity against divisive forces.
title: Operation name and two women send powerful message

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commended the security forces on Wednesday for their successful strikes against terror facilities in Pakistan and POK, stating the nation is "proud" of their efforts. Sources indicate Modi emphasized the operation's necessity and the importance of continued preparedness for future security challenges.
title: PM to Cabinet: Moment of pride, a unique op, it's only the beginning

author: DEBABRATA MOHAPATRA
description: Following India's strike on terror hideouts, Bhubaneswar witnessed a surge in sindoor sales as citizens celebrated 'Operation Sindoor'. People expressed national pride by applying sindoor, viewing it as a symbol of respect for the armed forces and solidarity with the nation. Shopkeepers reported unusually high demand, reflecting widespread support for India's decisive action.
title: As Bhubaneswar celebrates, sale of sindoor sees sharp rise

author: TNN
description: Following retaliatory attacks, Congress has voiced its support for the Indian armed forces' decisive response to terror emanating from Pakistan, reiterating backing for the government's decisions in avenging the Pahalgam killings. The Congress Working Committee convened to display political unity, suspending political programs indefinitely. The party lauded the courage of soldiers involved in 'Operation Sindoor' and pledged complete support to the forces.
title: Congress hails strikes against Pakistan, reiterates support to Centre

author: TNN
description: Congress is strategically aligning its messaging on the Pahalgam situation and conflict with Pakistan to project a united front and avoid internal discord. The party aims to reinforce its unconditional support for the government, preventing any deviations from the official stance. This approach seeks to solidify Congress's position and repair past missteps, particularly concerning national security matters.
title: Congress seeks to ensure messaging aligned with public mood

author: TNN
description: Following the Pahalgam terror massacre, India executed Operation Sindoor, a calculated retaliation involving precision strikes on nine terror hubs in Pakistan and PoK. The IAF and Army synchronized their efforts, utilizing Rafale, Mirage-2000, Sukhoi-30MKI fighters, and loitering munitions to dismantle terrorist infrastructure. The operation aimed to preempt further cross-border attacks while minimizing collateral damage, as confirmed by government officials.
title: India unleashes mayhem on 4 Pak & 5 POK terror hubs of LeT, Jaish, Hizb

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: India executed precision strikes on key terror infrastructure inside Pakistan, targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Muhammed strongholds. The strikes hit training camps and operational headquarters, including Muridke and Bahawalpur, long protected by Pakistan's military-intelligence apparatus. These facilities served as hubs for training, indoctrination, and planning numerous terror attacks against India, including the Pulwama attack, before being neutralized.
title: Notorious nine: Why India hit them

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court voiced serious worries about private individuals receiving defence land within cantonments and the alleged encroachment of nearly 10,000 acres. The court questioned the Defence Ministry's transparency regarding encroachment details and proposed an audit involving revenue department officials and the CAG. The progress of digitizing defence land records was also requested by the bench.
title: Supreme Court favours audit of defence land grants
